intro: Nautilocalyx colonensis, commonly known as the Caribbean sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Nautilocalyx colonensis thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
